comments.commentBody: How much more "progressive" should they be? The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 35% of federal income taxes. And please don't trot out the tired line of 90% marginal tax rates in the Eisenhower era. Unless you bring back all of the deductions, eliminate the entitlement programs created since then, and devastate the rest of the world's economies through WWII (eliminating competition), the argument is meaningless.

With every story that includes any mention of Sanders, the Times shows its true colors.

It too is in the pockets of the .1%

Lock.

Stock.

And barrel.

Thankfully, normal everyday Iowans have other opinions that will be expressed on caucus day.

Let the games begin.

And let the real reporting follow. If not from the Times, then from someone else.

Bernie Sanders has promised liberals more stuff than Hillary. So of course that gives him much attractiveness. Getting free stuff from government is what is leading us to government centralization, and inevitable socialist tyranny. The sharing of misery under socialism is the real promise of Bernie Sanders.

Well, I voted for the first time in my life for Eugene McCarthy. Look who won - - a Republican who brought us 4 more years of war and an invasion of Cambodia.

What are the foreign policy positions and experience of Sanders?

How would Sanders raise the money to counter the 900 million dollar Koch campaign?

Bernie isn't a socialist like Marx. He's a social democrat, like Scandinavia or, gasp, Germany.
Health care for all, paid vacation for all, paid maternity/paternity leave for all, paid sick leave for all, a living wage for all. If it's good enough for Mercedes Benz, Volkswagen and Siemens, should be good enough for American corporations, er, people.

Hillary, if elected in 2000, clearly would have both gone into Iraq and bailed out Wall Street -- just as Bush did.

So we would have all the same problems, minus the national rejection of Bush and the republicans that gave us Obama for two terms.

She is the worst of both worlds.
@513610, I support your position!
That awful war and that awful recession?  Hillary supported the war and she supported Wall Street.  Take off the blinders.

I am sick about the possibility that Bernie will undermine the Hillary's candidacy.
He will fade just as Nader did and at the same time help the Republicans win. Just as Nader helped Geo.W. Bush win.
Of course we got the Iraq war and a major recession as a result.
If you want to hand the presidency to the Republicans keep supporting Bernie.
Hillary is a more than a first rate candidate. She has proven her mettle in so many ways: as a senator, and as Secretary of State.
If you don't think the Republicans will be thrilled to have a socialist as the Democratic standard bearer think again.
Moreover, even if he won he'd never be able to actually get anything done. He'd have no ability to force his policies through Congress. He would not have the clout.
Please, please do not nominate Bernie as our Democratic candidate. As much as I like him, he'll be poison for us.

I changed my party to Democratic to vote in the primary elections in AZ, a very red state, to be able to vote for Mr. Sanders. My Father was a life-long Republican, who used to tell me that contributing to that party was the equivalent to the continuing democracy for one's children, but his party is so far removed from Eisenhower that it is today unrecognizable as being such.

If everyone received the poverty level plus $1, the poverty level would adjust upwards. That so many people that read the NY Times fail this basic reasoning test worries me about the future of this nation.

The Comedy Party advocates Welfare for All, replacing the welfare now paid only to the rich and the poor. Today, the poor receive food stamps, sometimes rent stamps, and sometimes tax refunds. The rich receive much more,, millions for each non-working farmer for example. The rest of us get nothing.

If everyone received a payment equal to the poverty level plus $1, there would no longer be any poverty. The economy would boom because demand would zoom upward. The rich would become a little more rich, but the 99% would do a lot better.

This has been tried in Canada and on US Indian reservations. It works. The cost would be less than the middle East wars, and could be paid by taxing unearned income of the rich (i.e., inheritance). Senator McGovern liked the idea.

To see this and other common sense steps, go to YouTube and watch Comedy Party Platform (2 min 9 sec). Then invite me to speak to your group and send a buck to Bernie. Thanks.

It just shows how shallow Hillary's support is away from her money raisers would be supporters.  Bernie Sanders is a joke. Worst than that, he is a professional politician, running for just about any position available. His economic ideas would turn us into another Greek tragedy.  His rhetoric boils down to worthless yak, yak, yak   We have a lot of serious problems, ISIS is growing in power and spreading to Yemen, Libya and our own leaders are telling us their planning an attack here. This is the group, Obama called a JV team and has bombed for months.    Our economy is so fragile that a country like Greece can thumb their nose at the EU and our DOW plummets.   We need a person who is  serious about bring safety and confidence to us and not on personal agendas. Saunders is no where near that person and Hillary hasn't shown any leadership that would make us feel safe in her hands, That is why her team is concerned about Saunders.

Just for the record, the people I talked to today sure aren't Repug operatives, they're workers in stores, no doubt making around $10/hr, working hard for 40-50 hours a week and barely able to stay afloat. In other words, the people to whom Bernie is speaking. And you know what? That's the majority of Americans. That's why Bernie's appeal is so magnetic, and real. And I think he's got a shot.
You're really not aware Bernie is running in the primary against Hillary?

No doubt a good amount of the "support" for Bernie is coming from GOP operatives trying to resurrect the ghosts of Ralph Nader, so that on election night 2016, despite Hillary leading in every poll, a "Sanders surge" will lead Jeb to a 49-48-3 win in FLA.

There is no way an anti-war, anti-bank candidate will be allowed anywhere near the White House. Same goes for Rand Paul.

Barry Sanders has a better shot at the White House than Bernie.

AK - Republicans currently hold 54 Senate seats. Democrats would have to oust 14 of the 24 incumbent Republican and not lose any of the 10 Democratic seats to prevent a filibuster. Even that assumes Democratic Senators would line up behind Sanders on his policy initiatives.

Slate has already realized Bernie is not on the gun control bandwagon. Rand Paul would have the same problem - a victory would be a stunning rebuke to the corporate government that rules the country, but actually governing will immediately butt heads with the corporate masters who really run things.

scrape the bottom - vote for Rodham.
a vote for Bernie means you'll never have to wonder what communism is really like - you'll experience it.

"said one Clinton adviser, who like several others spoke on the condition of anonymity"
This is one of Hillary's main problems. Slick, Grasping, and surrounded by "professionals"
Gee, the riots at the 68 convention and the assassinations of King and Kennedy didn't play a role? And the "electable" Hubert H Humphrey was the loser in the general, NOT McCarthy...
Tyrone you hit the nail on the head. Bernie's chances are beyond non existent, but sadly he seems to have the key to killing the chances of the Democratic party's ascendancy to the presidency.
I hope Bernie doesn't have a binder full of  information about Hillary
The super rich don't have $1 trillion to their name.   That kind of money only comes from taxing the middle class, where the bulk of the income exists.
...or, of course, we could always go with what you have to offer. Maybe, umm, Trump? Or Santorum? Or Cruz? Or Perry? Or Huckabee? The list goes on. I'll take my chances with Greece.
What a choice. One is a socialist who would lead this country down the path of Greece and the other would lie when only the truth would save her.

She has no core and will increasingly appear desparate and confused. She is cynical, corrupt, entitled and imperial. I have no idea in what she believes nor does she. The neo-cons, Israeli war lobby and wall streeters are waiting for the night they bought in the Lincoln bedroom. There is no authentic enthiusiasm for her candicacy, watching the pathetic lackey Huma try to block reporters and protestors on the 4th while trying to manufacture enthusiasm was painful. Disagree with a Clinton, youre gone. You'd think she was the only grandmother in the USA but the child, besides being a campaign prompt is the 100 million heir, with zero in common with the disdained working folks.
She's done, despite what the trolls scattered through the comments try to suggest.
A third party candidacy gives the election to whichever clown the Republicans nominate. Um, no.
How is it in any way possibly a contradiction to be a socialist and a union sympathizer? Do you even know what you're talking about? Of course he has union support!

MSC_123 you are so right. We have an excellent candidate in Hillary but the unrealistic idealists are doing their best to kill the chances of the Democratic party winning the presidency.
I am extremely distressed at the possibility of another disastrous Republican president such as Geo. Bush and more Supreme Court justices like Thomas or Scalia or Alito.

Hillary's image is carefully constructed and managed in a very professional manner, but not well enough to not look managed. George W. Bush was much better at managing his image so that it did not look managed. With Hillary it is obvious and grates on people. Her supporters make excuses and pretend not to see the management. But we know that, like Kremlinologists of yore, we have to read between the lines and look for subtle signals.

Some people are just like that; they cant help it. In terms of her position and who she would put on the Supreme Court, she is vastly preferable to any Republicans, and whether her image-making shows is not very relevant. If Bernie gives her reason to push her image a bit leftward, this is good because the country needs to hear leftish ideas.

If Republicans can believe in public that climate change is not a problem, progressives can believe in public that Hillary is not an image of herself.

This is not because of "rich people."  This is about a country that borrowed money to support people in a manner that the government could not afford.   No one held a gun to their head to get the money and their government agreed to the terms of the loan.  I have read that many citizens in Greece don't pay their "fair" share, they just don't pay.  Our country is headed down the same path of we don't quit following down the same path as Greece.  Kick Greece out of the Euro, this is their fault and they have too many internal problems for any more help because they cannot pay that back either without major changes in the government including the taxation issue.  Their government has shown that they are not willing to make these changes

Yes the Germans did. You missed WW2. Germany extorted loans form all occupied nations including Greece. So much was extorted that German GDP doubled for several years by plundering their victims. They forded loans from occupied governments at gun point so they could buy all of the best that Europe could produce and Germany consumed those goods. Germany was awash in other peoples cash and luxury goods until the end of 1943. Acknowledging her debt Germany signed the London treaty after the war in the 1950s and promised to repay those forced loans after Germany was reunified. Germany was reunified 25 years ago and nobody in Europe has seen a Euro paid back and they never will. That is because signing a treaty with Germany is and always has been an utter waste of time. Churchill had it right. Germany is either at your feet or at your throat.
